PIStitch2:
^Mother Tree: What once fed us and let us grow tall, has choked the soil. There is no room for our songs. Residuals still crowd this space.
Click and drag the red pollutants off the screen

PRStitch: ^<color=green>Plant:</color> What are you DOING? I was born with <font="Dirtpunk SDF">my</font> chemicals. I’ll DIE without <font="Dirtpunk SDF">them</font>.

^Plant: Don’t cut me off! Oh, you’re killing me, you STAMENPISTEL!
Mother Tree: Keep it up.

^Plant: I'm DONE!
Wait, is that a vibration in the soil? Who is whispering?
^<color=green>Plant:</color> What does it want? What <font="Dirtpunk SDF">does</font> it mean?
^<color=green>Plant:</color> I wish I could reach out <font="Dirtpunk SDF">to it</font>. But how?
^<color=green>Plant:</color> I feel a tickling, <font="Dirtpunk SDF">like</font> I need to move!

PNGStitch2:
^Plant: What are these things for?
SWEET SALTED SAP WHAT’S THIS???
PNGStitch3:
^Mother Tree: Little sproutling, you are ready to sing again. Listen and teach the others the microbial melody.
Click on the flashing cell to hear a hint

APStitch:
^Mother Tree: Be mindful of what you play. Much lurks in the soil, friends, foe, and neither. The song can summon all.
Click on the plant nodes to recreate the hint tune
^<color=green>Plant:</color> HELL YEAH I HAVE A VOICE!

MSStitch1: ^<color=lightblue>Mother Tree:</color> Yes, this is the <font="Dirtpunk SDF">true</font> song. The microbes are home, I feel their quivering, shivering joy.
MSStitch2: ^<color=green>Plant:</color> WOW! What are these tiny dots doing? What is this thrilling, filling feeling?
MSStitch3: ^<color=purple>Microbe1:</color> Hi hi <font="Dirtpunk SDF">hi</font>! You’re back, we’ll unpack!
MSStitch4: ^<color=purple>Microbe2:</color> You forgot? We care, we share! We shake it down we break it down! We nosh and snack and sup!
MSStitch5: ^<color=purple>Microbe2:</color> We plot for good rot! The good slop is in <font="Dirtpunk SDF">the</font> rot! We split, we breed, we live to feed!

FFStitch2:
^Fungi: I’m small, yes. But bring me food and I’ll thread myself through all things and entwine you and the earth. No cap!
Drag and drop small white particles onto the fuzzy white fungi.

FFStitch: ^Fungi: Sweet preserved decay, can you feeeeeel that? My tastebuds are opening again. Let me pull... and… reach.
^<color=lightblue>Mother Tree:</color> No one should be alone, least of all a little fungi. <font="Dirtpunk SDF">Fill</font> up their emptiness and be filled.
^<color=orange>Fungi:</color> I feel a rich spore song emerging, mycelium daydreams coursing, caressing, webbing.

CATStitch1: ^<color=lightblue>Mother Tree:</color> Can you feel the power? <font="Dirtpunk SDF">These</font> are networked beings, they need connection to survive. Plug them in to <font="Dirtpunk SDF">charge</font> their awareness and sing as one among many.
CATStitch2: ^<color=yellow>Hold P and draw a path with your mouse connecting the plant with one of the fungi</color>

PCStitch1: ^<color=lightblue>Mother Tree:</color> Hold on to your roots, little one. Do you hear that humming murmur rustling through every fiber? That’s the world in waiting.
PCStitch2: ^<color=green>Plant:</color> Woah, what is this? <font="Dirtpunk SDF">Links</font> of the past, present, future?
PCStitch3: ^<color=purple>Microbe2:</color> Wohoo! Let’s renew! Let’s come through! For you, for me, for we!
PCStitch4: ^<color=orange>Fungi:</color> Darling sproutling, our tendrils can bring food from beyond your reach and our touch can ferry the song across our cosmos.
PCStitch5: ^Plant: We can sing louder than anyone, we can stamenpistel SING!
PCStitch6: ^<color=lightblue>Mother Tree:</color> Across the web, I have felt roots burn, wither, and drown. Now that you have found each other, the quiet void has cracked open. The song has returned.
PCStitch7: ^Mother Tree: The louder the song, the more we can pull smog from the sky. Bury it in our roots deep in the earth. And sing.
PCStitch8:
^Mother Tree: Can you feel the silence around the edges of our song? All soil can sing again, if given space and care.
In your corner, do you sing?
